Help: I re-size my SWAP partition into 2 partitions for the other named "common" for common area file exchange, then the SWAP never ON anymore, what do I do?
check your fstab tobe sure its got the proper entry for the swap partition
you may need to  alter your /etc/fstab file to mount  the partition, and enable swap properly
your UUID for the swap may have changed.
and if you resize partitons some times the UUID can change.
for the 5th time.. check your /etc/fstab entry for the swap partition. compare the UUID with what blkid says it should be
look at the entry it has  for your swap partition. and the UUID # its using.
its not a command.. its what you do when you LOOK at the output of blkid and /etc/fstab
first command to run is 'sudo blkid' find out what one is the swap partition.  and make note of its UUID=####### data
and my /etc/fstab has a similer line that looks like
note the end of the line i pasted..   says 'swap' :)
thats the one you want the info on.
